Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label different types of habitats, such as a playground, forest, or pond, showing where plants and animals live.
The student can illustrate different living things in each habitat, like trees, grasses, squirrels, or fish, and label them appropriately.
The student can compare and contrast by showing different living things in at least two different habitats in their drawing.
The student can identify patterns by highlighting one similarity and one difference in plant or animal life between the habitats illustrated.
